byline.contributor: Joseph Goldstein and Nicole Perlroth contributed reporting.
byline.original: By BENJAMIN WEISER and MATT APUZZO

abstract: Government charges former federal agents Carl Mark Force IV of the Drug Enforcement Administration and Shaun W Bridges of the Secret Service with money laundering and wire fraud; allege that men sought to enrich themselves during investigation of online black market Silk Road, exploiting site's secrecy; agents had already resigned amid growing scrutiny.
lead_paragraph: The agents, one with the Drug Enforcement Administration and one with the Secret Service, have been charged with money laundering and wire fraud.

headline.main: Inquiry of Silk Road Website Spurred Agents’ Own Illegal Acts, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: Inquiry of Illicit Website Spurred Agents’ Own Illegal Acts, Officials Say

snippet: The agents, one with the Drug Enforcement Administration and one with the Secret Service, have been charged with money laundering and wire fraud.
